availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Jacob Caseman (Pendleton County, Kentucky, farm laborer and soldier.)

body.p: Pendleton County, Kentucky, farm laborer and soldier. Pennsylvania native. Son of Lydia Caseman. Married to Sarah Ann Mains in Bracken County, Kentucky, on October 21, 1857. Father of George F. Caseman, Ann Caseman, Jacob Caseman, and Lizzie Caseman. Resident of Pendleton County in 1850. Farm laborer in Pendleton County in 1860. Served in the Twenty-Third Kentucky Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A) as private from December 18, 1861 to May 18, 1864. Reported as deserted on August 11, 1862, in Smithville, Tennessee. Returned to service on March 30, 1863. Wounded at the Battle of Chickamauga, Georgia on September 20,1863. Discharged due to medical disability on May 18, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, District No. 1, p. 384A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, p. 626.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, Precinct No. 4, p. 457A.
Compiled Service Records of Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations from the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M319, Roll 0355.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994029, Bracken County Marriages.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), pp. 140-141.
